title: Contract events logs are empty
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (9fd44a7 2023-10-26T00:16:42.293111408Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Forge stopped returning the transaction logs in one of the releases from the last few days.

Example test:

```solidity
contract DummyTest is Test {
    event DummyEvent(uint256 indexed number);

    function test_expectEventEmit() public {
        vm.expectEmit(true, false, false, false);

       emit DummyEvent(1);

       emit DummyEvent(1);
    }
}
```

With `forge 0.2.0 (9fd44a7 2023-10-26T00:16:42.293111408Z)`:

```
❯ forge test -vvvv
[⠆] Compiling...
No files changed, compilation skipped

Running 1 test for test/Counter.t.sol:DummyTest
[PASS] test_expectEventEmit() (gas: 5442)
Traces:
  [5442] DummyTest::test_expectEventEmit()
    ├─ [0] VM::expectEmit(true, false, false, false)
    │   └─ ← ()
    ├─ emit DummyEvent()   <------- Notice how it doesn't include the number
    ├─ emit DummyEvent()
    └─ ← ()

Test result: ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; 0 skipped; finished in 601.15µs

Ran 1 test suites: 1 tests passed, 0 failed, 0 skipped (1 total tests)
```

With `forge 0.2.0 (1a1d653 2023-06-14T00:06:40.452758373Z)`:

```
Running 1 test for test/Counter.t.sol:DummyTest
[PASS] test_expectEventEmit() (gas: 5442)
Traces:
  [5442] DummyTest::test_expectEventEmit() 
    ├─ [0] VM::expectEmit(true, false, false, false) 
    │   └─ ← ()
    ├─ emit DummyEvent(number: 1)     <------- But this old version includes the number
    ├─ emit DummyEvent(number: 1)
    └─ ← ()

Test result: ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; finished in 450.80µs
```
